website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for an ankle brace that will protect your ankle and offer plenty of support, this product is your best overall bet.
pros: Supportive straps offer plenty of reinforcement for injured tendons and joints
The material is made from an anti-odor material that won't itch and that wicks moisture to help keep feet cool and dry
cons: On the more expensive side, but it's well worth the money if you want comprehensive support for your ankle

customer_reviews.title: Measured my foot as they said and these definitely run ...
customer_reviews.text: Measured my foot as they said and these definitely run small. Compression is one thing, cutting off circulation to your toes is another. Returning it to get something else as it’s also much more bulky than they claim and the Footlok strap is way too short to wrap my foot as directed.
customer_reviews.author: awolphyone

customer_reviews.title: Not supportive for PTTD
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty upset that this didn’t work for me. I’ve been suffering from PTTD for years now. I thought I would try this to begin with, I went with this product because of the reviews and saw some PTTD sufferers liked this. Unfortunately this does not work well for me. The fit is fine just it doesn’t stay put. It falls down over time making the white strap loose so it’s no longer mimicking the tendon. It’s unfortunate that this was kind of pricey and didn’t do a thing for me. I’m sure if you sprained an ankle or something this would be perfect. But for a person who suffers from PTTD don’t waste your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Dakoda B.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I had injured my foot somewhat while walking on uneven streets of Italy. Wasn’t really bothering me until I returned to the states and started playing pickleball. The morning after the second day I played, I awoke and could barely walk. Some research on the internet and I figured out that the tendon Above the arch was inflamed. This brace seemed to address the issue. Its rather costly but I ordered anyway. It took a little getting used to but now i cannot play with out it. Totaly protects the weak parts of my foot and i can play pickle ball for hours. Worth twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: laruso

customer_reviews.title: Not for me and if you return you pay shipping
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this works great for some people as per the reviews. For me there are too many pieces.... three.... not hard to put on but takes alot longer than my ASO brace and was bulkier in my shoe. I like my ASO because it's one piece... of I need to grab it to go quick I don't need to worry about making sure I have pieces, as it is one piece. The thing I'm not happy about is this was a prime free shipping item and if you return it you need to pay shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Mcash

customer_reviews.title: Good support, stability, no pain.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying this brace following an ORIF ankle procedure and several weeks in a plaster cast, followed by several weeks in an air cast. I found this to be very comfortable and stable. My only issue is that the instructions are only available through their website, in a video that can't be paused or rewound (at least on my Android phone). I wouldn't have minded if they'd included both print instructions and the QR code for viewing the video, but only the video option was available. Other than that, great product and I've been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Noelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: Check your sizing
customer_reviews.text: Beware I bought this for my PTTD and tried it on and it was huge! I ordered a small based on my measurements and checked the video, and couldn’t understand why there was so much extra Velcro and material on mine vs the video. On each part of the brace there was a tag stating XL instead of S. I also saw that there was a labeling sticker on the outside box that stated small over top of another one that stated XL. If it was the correct fit I could see it working out. However unlike a few reviewers, I was able to return for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist advised me to get a tall lace-up brace for my peritoneal tendonitis. I purchased one but returned it immediately when I found that I couldn't put my shoes on over it. So I decided to try the Bioskin Trilok ankle brace. It was very comfortable to wear once I mastered the the steps for putting it on. It took a few tries the first time but became second nature quickly. After about a week of wearing it all day I was able to start playing pickleball again (wearing the brace). Just as my doctor predicted my recovery took about two months. Now my ankle is back to full strength. I am extremely happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: GRB

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product and less you are absolutely sure this is what you want. There are NO RETURNS!!!!!!!i ordered a Medium n it was too small. I could not return it for a large.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Ackerson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I tweaked the perineal tendon above my ankle while running. It was tender/sore during routine walking and very painful with any more pressure than that. I ordered the brace because the description and reviews suggested it would do the job of the perineal tendon and allow continued activity within reason. I stopped running for about a month, but I resumed exercise-walking and cycling daily with the use of the brace with no pain. I've since been able to return to running. I wear an ankle sleeve as a precaution, but often I'll go ahead and put on the brace as a preventative measure since it hasn't been long since the injury. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: JLamp

customer_reviews.title: Alleviates my PTTD better than others
customer_reviews.text: I have posterior tibial tendonitis & this is the best of three ankle braces I have tried over the YEARS (chronic injuries SUK!!!). I think this brace is good enough to justify its cost. It has substantially increased my walking range. Mind you, it’s a little complicated - lots of straps and a wilderness of Velcro. But just go online to the site specified in the packaging, watch the video a couple times, and you’ll be good to go. I hope it works as well for you as it has for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not suit everybody
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great and had a lot of good reviews on Amazon so that I had very high expectation on it. But I was disappointed when I tried it on myself. The second and the third strap made me hurt more when I tried to tighten them. I had a cuboid fracture, and maybe this product does not work for that. It is a pity that Amazon did not have a 30-day return policy for that. I found within the box an instruction paper saying I could return it directly to bioskin. However, the custom service line could never be reached and my return request email never got a reply. Really disappointed by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to help combat a bad case of posterior tibial tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help combat a bad case of posterior tibial tendonitis. I'm not as sold as some others as to the ability of this brace to offer complete relief from pain, but it definitely does stabilize the ankle far better than any other brace I've tried. I believe in time and after some additional healing this brace will be very useful in the overall recovery process.
customer_reviews.author: bdf4gam3

customer_reviews.title: Used this to replace an external orthotic
customer_reviews.text: I have a misaligned heel and a completely fallen arch. Until recently, I had an external orthotic which was designed to align my foot. However, it was no longer working, and I needed to find something to use to mitigate the pain until I could be evaluated for surgical repair. I purchased this based on reviews which stated that persons with PTTD had found pain relief. The two straps that support the arch and the heel have been invaluable, and I have found that while this brace won't help with realigning my foot, it has definitely helped with the pain, and my limp has been greatly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: A peroneal tendon issue had me lame for 6 wks , plus weeks of PT before purchasing this brace. Two weeks wearing it I'm back into cycling and light hiking...with it on of course. I also wear it with sturdy flip flops. Very stable and fairly easy to use once u get the hang of it. I put on the main part of the brace, add a med weight sock, then the rest of it. Still fits in a lace up shoe. I swim in the rivers and lake with it on all so. Hand wash and line dry.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: Wow NO returns on this item! It is way too small even though I ordered right size so basically I have just wasted $70 The band around the arch of the foot has extreme compress and is totally unsuitable for anyone who has certain foot problems...I have suspected tendonitis and extreme compression could worsen the condition. Very disappointed that Amazon lists products from companies like this . It certainly was not made clear that no returns are allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Barabara

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting used to put put on, but the videos really helped me learn to do it right. After a few times, it becomes second nature. The PTTD brace is amazing. The pain from my tendon was gone while I wore it, and at night the pain was barely there after I removed the brace. It allowed my tendon an opportunity to heal and not continue being damaged. This is worth the extra cost. I have bought the $5 and $15 at Walmart and the drug store. Although those offer some compression, they do not immobilize the posterior tibial tendon like the BioSkin brace does. There is a huge difference. I would buy another one if needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Even Better Service
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays club volleyball and she twisted her ankle. These ankle braces were recommended by her physical therapist. We originally ordered the incorrect size, when I tried to return through Amazon it said something like “Can Not Return”. NOT TRUE! I send an inquiry through Amazon and the company replied within 24 hrs. They let me know they had already shipped out my replacement, and had enclosed a return label to send back the brace that didn’t fit!!! AWESOME RIGHT!! No hassle, just did the right thing!! Way to go Bio Skin. You get customer service!! Thank you, Loyal Customer
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Although I followed the sizing instructions, the fit of this brace was awful. There was considerably extra fabric in the leg and achilles areas that developed folds that would surely cause blisters during extended walking/hiking. Additionally, the design is too complex to get proper ankle support; you have to cut off circulation to your foot in the arch and metatarsal areas to obtain appropriate support of the lateral ligaments and tendons. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Cary S Green

customer_reviews.title: These are very complicated and time consuming to put on ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very complicated and time consuming to put on. Tried one on and it was extremely uncomfortable. To top it off you can’t return them. So now I’m stuck with $140 ankle braces that I’ll never use. If something can’t be returned then that should be clearly noted when you check out or have a box that has to be checked to make sure the consumer is aware that the sale is final. I would never have purchased them had I known that detail.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Functional and Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I was prescribed these from my doctor for pronation foot deformity. I was skeptical of the lack of solid pieces as I need to have support to the left and right of my ankle. All the components are straps and cloth. They took me only one time looking over the directions before I was able to adjust and apply the straps to what I needed. My favorite part? My doctor charges almost $200 a piece! Amazing price for someone who can't afford doctor prices!
customer_reviews.author: R. Green

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful, although skeptical. This is the third day using it and I realized earlier while out walking "I don't have any pain." I don't know why it works, but it does for my self-diagnosed PTTD. The area where my arch is supposed to be hurt constantly, but no more. It is a bit convoluted to put on. I used the instructions the first two days, but today put it on without a hitch. It adds some bulk, but still fits in my boots and dress shoes. I was worried about the price, but being pain free is more than worth it. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Greg K

customer_reviews.title: ... and has an accessory navicular bone that was quite painful when she played
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace for my 10 year old daughter who plays soccer and has an accessory navicular bone that was quite painful when she played. She began wearing this brace every time she practiced and played and her complaints of pain decreased significantly almost to no complaints at all. She is still wearing now. The only down side to the brace so far is that the elastic strap on the top has unraveled in some places. But it has not interferred with use of the brace.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly works!!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions on wrapping for PTTD and wasn't sure I did it right. I must have done it right. The pain is way less. Immediately after wearing it for the first time. I Will post more after wearing it at work on my feet all day. By the way, I have the silver plan health insurance that you can't use unless your rich. I am not a doctor, but without going to a specialist I may have lucked out with this one brace, Please let it work continuously and not fail I [ray.
customer_reviews.author: robert mandus

customer_reviews.title: If you have thick ankles it will not fit....useless
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the larges size because my ankles are thick. Add to that some swelling from tendinitis in the outside tendon. The part that goes around the foot is fine. The part that wraps the ankle is the problem. The straps are way too short unless you have average or smaller ankles. The lowest strap had maybe 1 inch of Velcro to attach, strap 2 maybe 1/2 inch and the top strap was 1. 1/2 inches too short and couldn't be attached.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T

customer_reviews.title: Very Great Product BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PTTD Trilok brace. Unfortunately it did not meet my needs with my flat feet. It is great for ankle bracing, heel relief, and tibia stability. It does provide SOME support to my arches but not fully. It’s really a brace for the other things they say it treats. Saying that, I needed to get a full refund and make a return so I emailed customer service and they took good care of me. I was skeptical that I wouldn’t be able to get my refund bc I read other reviews that says they don’t but idk what’s up with that bc my package came with a ‘returns & exchanges’ card from BioSkin and got a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fussy to put on but worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: I have a combination of medical conditions and injuries that have rendered my ankles unstable many days. These are fantastic for their level of comfort and adjustability for nearly daily use. However, I find them a little fussy to put on-- which might be a deal-killer if you needed to take them on and off quickly or multiple times a day. In my case, I find them worth the trouble. They provide me with the lateral support I need and are not bulky. I wear them over compression socks and usually forget they are even there throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: alzoe

customer_reviews.title: You can comfortably run and exercise in this brace!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, much better than lace-up braces. Importantly, you can run and exercise in this brace. I sprained my ankle badly 10 months ago, and it is still not back to full strength. I’ll run on the treadmill without a brace, but I wear this whenever I run outdoors just to protect against another sprain. Running without a brace is more comfortable, but this is the only one I’ve found that I can actually run in that doesn’t cause pain, blisters and chafing. It’s a bit complicated to put on, but once you figure it out, not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: TBerr

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not offer good support. My ankle feels worse since I received it yesterday. I have tried to put it on three times and i am unable to walk comfortably. I will try my lock with the older lace up models that worked. Very disappointed since this item was so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal K. White

customer_reviews.title: Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: I measured according to the images. I was well under the max limit and the white Tendon strap didn’t even come up to the bottom of my ankle. Black aspect fit nice and snug and perfectly. I do wonder if I received a bad white strap. Returned due to strap fraying due to poor seam.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi (DeCoyAbLe)

customer_reviews.title: awesome brace
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this brace. It works really well and gives wonderful support. It was complicated only the first time I put it on. After that it's actually very easy and it makes sense. I like the fact that it has so many straps and it's all Velcro, as it offers the best support that way. Highly recommend it. bought it because I have issues with the tendon that goes right under the navicular. Might be an accessory navicular issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna

customer_reviews.title: Support Protection Comfort Customer Service ++
customer_reviews.text: 6 weeks ago I sprained my ankle. MRI showed I also have a fragmented cartilage in the ankle (known as osteochondritis) which has been making walking very painful. I've been in a walking boot for several weeks and wanted another option. This 3 part system has been a great option. The rigid 1st layer, plus the other straps stabilized the whole ankle perfectly. I also initially ordered a smaller size. Even though Amazon says no returns, I emailed the company directly and they exchanged for a larger size which was delivered in a few days. Including shipping label.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Bhavilai

customer_reviews.title: Damages feet, bruises calves, and very difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This brace feels comfortable at first, after 20 minutes of adjusting straps. But it actually damaged (crushed) a large vein on my foot which no longer has blood flow, hurt my extensor digitorum longus tendons (very red, inflamed, and sore) on the same foot, and bruised both calves. It also makes your toes go numb. I still have the crushed vein and sore tendons on one foot 8 weeks later. I bought one for each foot, tried them multiple times before giving up, and of course, no returns. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for Peroneal Tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: This brace is advertised to work for peroneal tendonitis. It doesn't. It also apparently is not returned and that is not disclosed anywhere on the description, so buyer beware. I wore this for an hour and thought my whole foot was going to break. It might be a decent ankle support, but it's not for peroneal tendon issues so they shouldn't advertise that it is.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Do not consider if you also have a broken foot
customer_reviews.text: This brace does not adjust around the metatarsal area since it is a solid piece of elastic fabric. I had an avulsion fracture (sprained ankle with torn ligaments, broken ankle, and fractured 5th metatarsal) and I could not get the solid fabric part of the brace over my foot without screaming pain. I actually could not even use the brace and had to return it for that reason. If you just have a sprain, it looks like a good brace. But if your injury includes a broken foot, get a brace with lacing over the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Finally. Something that works.
customer_reviews.text: I have had PTTD (posterior tibialis tendon disfunction) for many years. Have had two surgeries to address it, with long recovery times and mediocre results and continuing pain. This is the first support that has given me relief from pain and stability to keep me going throughout the day. It is easy to put on, provides great support, and is very comfortable. I can wear it all day. It is a little hot during the hot summer heat, but not more than a sweat sock would be and well worth the relief provided. I don't know about other foot/ankle issues, but for PTTD it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Wenell

customer_reviews.title: Does not help me relieve pain and discomfort of PTTD.
customer_reviews.text: I wear an Arizona brace but ordered this to use while wearing normal footwear and to wear around the house to give my foot a brake from the Arizona brace. It provides relief for about one hour and then the pain returns. It raises up the arch fine but does not hold up very long, After about an hour I have to take it off. It does not support the ankle well either. I am very disappointed. I am very disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for peroneal tendinitis pain
customer_reviews.text: Great for peroneal tendinitis. Much better support and comfort compared to the walking boot or hard plastic brace my doctor had me wearing. I spent 20 very frustrating minutes learning how to put it on, but now it a pretty quick process. It easily fits in my work boots and significantly reduces my pain level as soon as I put it on. Only downside is that my sock sometimes gets bunched up underneath it and gets uncomfortable. Overall it's by far the best brace I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Stable and releases pressure
customer_reviews.text: Provides great stability for my ankle, and releases the pressure to my tendon. Fits in my sneakers pretty well. I haven't tried to wear with any other shoes. Didn't give a 5 star rating because the area on the top of my foot, where the straps "cris-cross" gets a little sore from the pressure of the straps. In fact I now have a dark spot on the top my foot, (at the ankle," right at the bottom of my leg") where the straps over laps. Other than that it works pretty well, and stays firm through out the entire wear time, meaning the straps don't loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Variety LaUnique

customer_reviews.title: son couldn't use it - VERY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing 2 weeks. My son has tried to use it but very uncomfortable. Created pain in other areas of the foot. The vendor or amazon wont allow a return and its only been 2 weeks,
customer_reviews.author: lins421

customer_reviews.title: NOT effective for medial/lateral support!
customer_reviews.text: This brace is absolutely ineffective for medial and lateral instability although it states clearly that it prevents inversion and eversion and can be used for ankle instability. There are no supports other than the strapping which provide very minimal support. At best this provides compression at ankle and midfoot but I would never wear it for dynamic support. This may be a very effective brace for the plantar fascitis and/or posterior tibialis insufficiency but that's not what I was looking for and this seller does not take returns. Don't waste your money if you're looking for a stability brace.
customer_reviews.author: PTmum

customer_reviews.title: Helped so much
customer_reviews.text: I did the measurements and it show right on the high end of the small size so I ordered a small. It was too small. I called them at 7 pm July 3rd and the lady on the phone was so nice and helpful and immediately send a medium one. After getting the right size, the pain started to get better. It help so much and it is incredible. Wish I would have bought it sooner instead of wasting time with the cheaper ones
customer_reviews.author: WendiD

customer_reviews.title: Good for peroneal tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with peroneal tendonitis (yes, self-diagnosis but I am a textbook case). I've been using this for support and it certainly helps. It's probably not as good as the boot stabilizer from the doctor, but doctor's visits cost a fortune so I didn't go.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Drinnon

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for PTTD
customer_reviews.text: I was recently diagnosed as having PTTD. My podiatrist suggested a few devices and I selected this one. It took a while and watching the video before I got it right. It is a good fit and reduces the pain and stabilizes my ankle. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: elwinbrown2

customer_reviews.title: I bought the aircast brace and I like it but it is hard to get a shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the aircast brace and I like it but it is hard to get a shoe on. So I thought I would try this one. I've only had it two days but I can get closed shoes and sneakers on so much easier. It's a little hard to figure out at first, so keep the instructions with you till you get it down. I bought the size it said and it seemed like it might be a little tight at first but I haven't had any problem with it so far. I bought this for PTTD and it seems to be okay for that as I don't have that posterior medial malleolus pain. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: MQOH

customer_reviews.title: Works for paon relief, but too hot and expensive.
customer_reviews.text: This does work for relief of plantar fasciitis. However,they are HOT, HOT, HOT, which is too bad because I absolutely cannot stand to wear them in the summer. Also, they are nonreturnable. I am not sure they are worth $140 to me in the end. I also bought something called walkfit to try, and that product works just as well to take away my pain and support my feet without the heat problem (and they were only $25). I will still wear these in the winter for sure when I will like the added bonus of a foot warmer (and, thus, a whole body warmer for me)
customer_reviews.author: sheepluvlsu

customer_reviews.title: The item is much too tight on my wife's foot ...
customer_reviews.text: The item is much too tight on my wife's foot; AND, when I decided to return it and order the next larger size I was NOTIFIED thet - "YHIS ITEM CANNOT BE RETURNED ! "
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!! NO returns or exchange !
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!!!!! This company does NOT except exchanges or returns! How Crazy is that !!!!! Disappointed in this product & wished I had NEVER ordered it !!!
customer_reviews.author: F Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Found this brace on Amazon and it was the only brace that got very good reviews. Ordered it and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I have peroneal tendonitis and 6 months ago had to wear a walking boot for it for about 4 weeks. I recently tweaked it again from running and was searching online for a brace that I could wear while working out and would not only help the pain if I had some, but also protect it. Found this brace on Amazon and it was the only brace that got very good reviews. Ordered it and I love it! I've worn it with tennis shoes while working out or flip flops while walking around. I wear a size 9-9.5 shoe and I got the medium and it fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This brace worked great. It was much cheaper on Amazon than buying ...
customer_reviews.text: This brace worked great. It was much cheaper on Amazon than buying it from the doctor's office. If you have a neoprene sensitivity you will have to wear more than one pair of socks, which makes it really hot. It worked great for helping my ankles, I had to wear a pair of these for 8 weeks. Luckily it was winter time since I had to wear two layers underneath them to keep from breaking out due to the neoprene.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me and it's not eligible for return !!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get fooled by all reviews, consider this option carefully !!!Did not work for me, had more pain walking with it than without! Tried to return it and what do you know, IT'S NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN !!! Thanks a lot Bioskin 👌
customer_reviews.author: Florea Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Order a size larger than you need.
customer_reviews.text: The front portion is very tight, and I ordered one size up to fit my ankle. The rest is good. You have to wear a sock under it or it scratches you. It did not help my problem, but don't blame it on the brace. I think I was misdiagnosed!
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: The support is great but the brace is expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brace, just not the price. After ankle surgery on my left foot and not being able to put any weight on it for 8 weeks, this brace has been a life saver for my right foot. Unfortunately I could use two of them for when the other one needs washed. But because of the price, I will have to do with just one.
customer_reviews.author: Millsy

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item. It took 30 minutes to put it on and was super uncomfortable and actually hurt my foot more. My shoe wouldn’t go over it either.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Ezell

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is too small!
customer_reviews.text: I took my ankle and foot measurements as instructed, and I was well within the measurements for a size Large brace. When I tried it on, I only got the foot portion on, and it was extremely tight, so as to cut circulation. Amazon has refused to exchange it, and Sports Proffessionals, the vendor, has not responded to two emails. I am out $69!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Murch

customer_reviews.title: non refundable
customer_reviews.text: not at all what I thought it would look like! at 70.00 you should have indicated that it was not refundable!!!! It is not thin and lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why can I return this unusable brace????
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product... impossible to use. Just found out no returns allowed!!!!! Why??????
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my mom who has pretty bad PTTD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom who has pretty bad PTTD, and I am a physician myself. It really is a great brace, offers good stability and is definitely one of the best options out there. I would buy this again and would recommend it to others. One star off because it is a little difficult to put on but once you get the hang of it, its fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Helps with Plantar Faciitis. Had one previously, got better, and seem to have lost it. Found this exact same one for cheaper than the doctor had available. There’s a lot of Velcro straps and it’s not particularly comfortable, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's complicated to get strapped on at first. When ...
customer_reviews.text: It's complicated to get strapped on at first. When I first got it, it's seemed to work well I've had it for several weeks now and my ankle continues to hurt. It is a very supportive when I'm wearing it and it alleviates the pain somewhat but as soon as it comes off I am back to square one. I'm sooooooo frustrated with my 2 year PTTD.
customer_reviews.author: Adena R. Truett

customer_reviews.title: It's alright but not a godsend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace to help with some peroneal tendonitis that I have been dealing with for a while now. While this brace is great for stability, I've found that it doesn't help much with my peroneal tendonitis issues and sometimes it can be uncomfortable and cause more pain for me. If you're using it for stability, then it is great but for the most part you can get the same effect from a lace-up brace.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great support post-surgery
customer_reviews.text: I have had two surgeries to repair torn peroneal tendons in my foot and ankle. After eight weeks being non-weight bearing with each surgery, this brace was essential to my recovery as I began to bear weight and strengthen my foot and ankle again. It provides great support without feeling too binding. It will fit down in my shoe fairly comfortably. I definitely feel more secure wearing it. The different straps can be confusing, but after a few times putting it on, I had no difficulty. Highly recommend this brace and imagine it would be useful in a variety of situations.
customer_reviews.author: 4kidsmom

customer_reviews.title: Peroneal Tendon recovery
customer_reviews.text: I had a very swollen ankle due to a peroneal tendon popping out and back in during a training run. Doctor put me in a walking boot for a week and then I transitioned to the Tri Lok ankle brace for a relay race where I was responsible for 31 miles of running in 2 days only a week later. This brace did EVERYTHING I had hoped for in providing stability and most importantly confidence to knowing my ankle was secure.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky. But it does work. I had to watch the video on youtube a couple times to figure out how to put it on. They should make it more breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon LJ

customer_reviews.title: good but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Feels pretty comfortable for awhile, but leaves dents that are kinda bruise-like on the sides of my ankle. I feel like they are very expensive, and you CANNOT return them, so make SURE you get your size right.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Gelinas

customer_reviews.title: Great ankle brace for plantar fasciitis!
customer_reviews.text: This ankle brace is the best I’ve ever tried before and it’s great for plantar fasciitis. The trilok advantage gave me comfort and stability to walk without pain and the entire brace fits perfectly in shoes I can wear to work along with my inserts. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Santoya

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd brace Dr. Recommended I use the heck out of it... The white strap decreases the arch pain other braces gave me
customer_reviews.author: Marla Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for PTTD at all, and this item can't be returned, you're better off just flushing $70 down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Cade Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Good brace but...
customer_reviews.text: It fits well and seems comfortable but it is somewhat challenging to put on and take off. I am a PT, so I am familiar with the directions to pull, and I like the idea, but the amount of velcro could be challenging for some. I think the lateral support is great, but I don't feel much relief from my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Pain Free!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brace. Took all my pain away. Back to doing everyday tasks and don’t even notice it is on. Tendon in left foot is shredded and I have flat feet. This is easy to put on once you have done it several times.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the ankle brace 3 days. The first day was a pleasant upside surprise. After golfing 18 holes, my foot, leg, hip and back were pain free. A first for many years. The second day had the same result with the caveat of making the top of my foot sore. Yesterday, the third day, i only wore it for a couple of hours due to the top of the foot issue. All in all, I am quite pleased with the brace. Perhaps I am not donning it properly or maybe I can tape the affected area while wearing the brace. Either way I am satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with foot tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this brace, my tendonitis was so bad in my foot that I had a hard time doing basic things like standing longer than 15 minutes at a time. However, with this brace, I can be more active without all of the pain. If you are dealing with tendon issues in your foot, i highly recommend this brace.
customer_reviews.author: Apple Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good brace and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Brace is wonderful for my PTTD. Takes the pressure off my arch to help it heal. Global Wholesale customer service was great to work with also
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn M

customer_reviews.title: Bioskin trilok ankle brace
customer_reviews.text: The brace was comfortable to wear with any shoe or boot. When I put it on over a sock there was no sore spots. I especially liked that it did not impede normal function and movement. My use was for a twisted ankle. This brace has allowed me to continue hiking and hunting without discomfort or the risk of additional injury. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ginest

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this and try it for my PTTD but after only about 3 hours of use it caused pain in a new part of my foot (on the outside). Very disappointed and apparently they won’t let me return it. Would not recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Traci C.

customer_reviews.title: Good support, but bulky and tricky to put on
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this, but it has so many parts I need the instructions each time to put it on. And then I can never get it as smooth as the picture, so it's too bulky to fit inside most of my shoes. I'm going to keep trying, though, because it does support my ankle well, and I can wrap it where I need it most.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a good brace and can see why it works for many ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it didn't work for me. It wasn't strong enough and I ended up with a Richie style AFO. However, I think it's a good brace and can see why it works for many people. It is a bit of a learning curve with all the Velcro straps, but if that helps to avoid wearing a hard plastic device, well worth the time. It does seem to run just a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase with Best results!
customer_reviews.text: Seems complicated to put on properly, but it was easy after watching the tutorial video. I've gone from a walking boot to this and it is sooo much more comfortable. I still get good support during 10 plus hour shift of standing and walking. Best purchase with Best results for my PTTD pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for Torn Tendon on Ankle
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended this but it was not good for an ankle tendon tear. With the heel cut out the trim cut right across the tear. So it was very painful. It addition it is very difficult to figure out how to use. You need to watch a video to put it on. I had to return it. The customer service is excellent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cary Grandfield

customer_reviews.title: Bioskin ankle brace
customer_reviews.text: my achilles tendon is wrapped around a bone spur. I am having surgery, but am using this brace in the mean time to alleviate the pain. It has helped a lot. I have to keep viewing the video to put it on correctly, but I am sure after a few more times, I will have it down
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never written an Amazon review before. While this company seems professional, this is by far the most confusing piece of equipment I’ve ever come across. Can’t even use it after watching the instructional video several times.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Norris

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a bit worried that I would have difficulty putting this brace on but thanks to their detailed video tutorial it was really simple. I know it isn't the least expensive brace out there but that's because it is intricately and thoughtfully designed, comfortable and effective. Believe me when I say it is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a very high quality brace. It was recommended by a volleyball coach after my daughter turned her ankle badly. She was able to play the next day with this brace.
customer_reviews.author: kfccarling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great...ankle did feel supported and was able to heal properly.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: Be certain product will work for your issue
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for my issue, Posterior Tibial Tendon Deformity. Instructions very difficult to follow. Sure it does work for other foot and ankle issues
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Tolbert

customer_reviews.title: Functional and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I totally tore my posterior tibial tendon and was fit for a Ritchie brace. It was like lugging a tool box strapped to your leg. I purchased this to wear to bed to stabilize my ankle. This little brace does the job better and more comfortably. This is what I wear every day.
customer_reviews.author: Marie A Burger-Zaccagnino

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for paroneal tendinitis. Strap fit directly over fifth metatarsal (the painful area). Couldn't use. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B. Consolvo

customer_reviews.title: Very easy returns to Bioskin. Fantastic customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy Returns! I ended up returning this item because it won’t work for me. (There’s nothing wrong with product). Amazon states this is non returnable to Amazon, so I called Bioskin directly. Fantastic customer service and they emailed me a prepaid return label. I highly recommend Bioskin.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teenage football player
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old son has amazing football skills. Unfortunately his ankle strength hasn't kept up with his speed and agility. This was a perfect short term solution while we work on strengthening his ankles. Easy enough for him to apply without help after the first time
customer_reviews.author: Loves to read

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: So the product may be great—I’m not sure because I can’t use it. Someone printed a “medium” label over the large label so it’s too big. I had to call the manufacturer to send me a new one, which will arrive in about a week. Not sure who’s to blame but check the package carefully when it arrives!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl T

customer_reviews.title: very supportive
customer_reviews.text: Not best fit for me, but excellent supportive, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Hinrichs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my foot (linsfranc fracture) and it helps with the pain when I walk. The only thing is that (for me ) I can't wear too long because my foot swells up and it starts to feel uncomfortable. I can see how it would help with other issues.
customer_reviews.author: mrst_13

customer_reviews.title: Very pain relieving!!
customer_reviews.text: Much pain relieved with this brace. I have had many ankle braces in my life, and this one by far takes the cake. So much support. It fits snuggly, but you really need it to for the support. Make sure and watch the video on their website showing how it goes on. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Forewarning - no returns allowed  - should tell you something!
customer_reviews.text: Be forewarned: Amazon does not allow returns. Ordered two. Received them yesterday. Worthless product.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie Laker

customer_reviews.title: Not for folks with big calf's
customer_reviews.text: The ankle support was OK, but candidly a well wrapped ACE bandage is better. The real issue for me is the fit at the very top of the brace. It totally dug into my calf to the point it became too painful to wear. Granted, I have big calf's. SO if you calf's are small, this should be better for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bickford

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for what turned out to be an avulsion fracture (ligament pulled a small chunk of bone away instead of tearing). This still worked very well to stabilize ankle relieveb pain.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The price marked is a price for one, not for a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chaomeng Wu

customer_reviews.title: To complicated to use! DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: This brace is too damn complicated to get attached properly. Even using the video it is too hard to get on and I am a former CPD. To make this worse, it has a NO RETURN POLICY. I WILL NEVER ORDER ANYTHING FROM THIS COMPANY AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: BamaBullitt

customer_reviews.title: A miracle!
customer_reviews.text: This brace is absolutely amazing! It is a perfectly-padded, stabilizing brace combined with straps that mimic taping. I have a permanent injury & this has allowed me to keep walking without any chance of further damage. I’m on my second one. The first one lasted for 2 years with very rugged daily use. A total lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Ciaccio

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: To much trying to get it on right not as tight fitting...almost clumsily flimsy just missed my return window yesterday would have returned! I buy alot of things from amazon...not thrilled with this purchase to much money to spend would have expected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Robl

customer_reviews.title: This really helped my ankle and my PTTD Diagnosis
customer_reviews.text: Very supportive, a little hard to get used to applying. There is a You Tube video.
customer_reviews.author: heidi brackett lawrence

product_meta.title: BioSkin Trilok Ankle Brace - Foot and Ankle Support for Ankle Sprains, Plantar Fasciitis, PTTD, Tendonitis and Active Ankle Stability - Lightweight, Hypo-Allergenic (Medium)
feature_bullets: FOOT and ANKLE SUPPORT: Plantar Fasciitis, PTTD, Peroneal Tendonitis, ankle sprains and rolled ankles are caused by weakened or torn tendons. The Trilok is made from three main components that mimic your body’s natural tendons to secure your ankle and allow a safe range of motion. These straps encourage healthy arch posture, and prevent inversion and eversion.

CALCULATED COMPRESSION: The micro-fleece lined compression sleeve is a comfortable way to reduce swelling in the foot and ankle after an injury. Compression also improves recovery time, increasing blood flow to bring nutrients to the site of the injury.

PREMIUM COMFORT: The Trilok is made from soft Hypo-Allergenic materials that are breathable and low profile, rather than bulky, suffocating canvas braces. The Trilok allows for active mobility but restricts harmful movements making it perfect for sports and regaining mobility.

FIT and SIZING: Measure around your arch at the thickest point and compare this measurement to the size chart shown in the second image. Then measure the circumference of your leg right above your ankle and make sure this measurement is below the maximum ankle circumference.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
